notes.content: Using CHAR(36) for GUIDs is inefficient. Consider using BINARY(16) with UUID_TO_BIN() and BIN_TO_UUID() functions for better storage efficiency and performance.
Multiple tables use TEXT columns for structured data (e.g., comma-separated values). Consider normalizing these into separate tables for better query performance and data integrity.
TINYINT(1) is used for boolean values. While functional, consider using BIT(1) for slightly better storage efficiency, though TINYINT(1) is commonly accepted practice.
